body:
I'm getting the error:
```
  >> 2239    /home2/rpfische/spack6/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/python-3.5.2-cn5dmlafquyuutnpnqeflshpyono765t/lib/pyt
             hon3.5/distutils/dist.py:261: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'define_macros'
     2240      warnings.warn(msg)
     2241    Traceback (most recent call last):
     2242      File "setup.py", line 394, in <module>
     2243        setup_package()
     2244      File "setup.py", line 386, in setup_package
     2245        setup(**metadata)
```

In this case, both NumPy and OpenBLAS are upgraded to the latest version; but the result is the same using the Spack defaults in Spack's `develop` branch.

Any ideas?  This is like https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/33
[spack-build.out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/1952815/spack-build.out.txt)
title: Problems Building py-numpy + OpenBLAS
